wiki.content:
"Crawling" is a song by the band Linkin Park. It is the fifth track from their debut album Hybrid Theory (2000). It was released in 2001 as their second single and won a Grammy for Best Hard Rock Performance in 2002.
 A demo version of the song recorded during the production of Hybrid Theory features an interlude of Mike rapping before the last chorus.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.

track.name: Crawling
comments: NOW THAT'S WHAT I CALL EDGY
This is so emo if you think about it. :D

There's a shit ton of posing little kids playing breakdowns with rebecca black choruses these days that teenagers think is metal, linkin park made never pretended to be edgy, they just do what they do and occasionally put out an interesting track.
the epitome of edgy teenage poser metal
"You've listened to Linkin Park 863 times." I know I used to be a huge fan of them as a kid but holy shit...
Brings me back fuckin great times..
love the intro..this album is good for working out as well
Seriously one of their best songs ever! I miss them sounding like this.
